name: Rathbone Mansions

reviews.title: Enjoyed The Stay
reviews.text: We had a very pleasant stay at the Rathbone Mansion 3/6/04 and enjoyed our visit. We had been staying at the Loew's hotel ($300+) on business for 2 nights prior. The room we stayed in was behind the rathbone inn #315 and had recently been renovated. We found it very nice and large.

reviews.title: We had a great stay
reviews.text: The furniture and furnishings were new. In fact, almost everything outside of the building itself seemed to be nearly new. The main house (Rathbone Mansion) which was across the street from out room had a nice pool and hottub. We found it just like the picture on Rathbone's web site. The pool is not huge but we mostly had it to ourselves. It was clean and looked almost exactly as it does on the website.

reviews.title: Would Never Visit or Recommend the Place!!!
reviews.text: I was initially a little concerned about the neighborhood but became comfortable with it during our stay. Esplanade and Rampart I was told was the boundary of the French Quarter which tourists should stay within. As it turned out Rathbone's neighborhood was ok. I wouldn't want to go any farther away from the French Quarter though. Another thing that I did not know prior to coming to New Orleans is that the first 4 or 5 blocks of Boubon street from Esplanade seems mostly desserted. I latter came to find out that there are expensive houses along the street but they do not open up to Bourbon street. I would recommend taking a cab home at night unless you are with a group or a very adventurous. After taking a run during the day and checking things out I didn't really feel completely comfortable walking to of from the French Quarter at night. It's probably ok but there are stretches where you might not see many other people and you could be a target.

reviews.title: Loved the Rathbone Inn !
reviews.text: Overall I would recommend this property. Not sure what the people that gave a poor review experienced. Not sure if the property has changed or what. We did not have a car so I can't comment on the parking. It appeared to me that people were parking in a gated area near the Rathbone mansion from what I could tell. From what I understand the property allows pets as well and has very reasonable weekday rates. We stayed on a weekend when hotels were very scarce and paid $129. There was a large convention in town and there were literally no rooms available at any of the hotels and B&B's were difficult to find rooms at as well. We were happy with the rate given the weekend.

reviews.title: most relaxing vacation ever
reviews.text: Everyone at the Rathbone Inn was very helpful and made this the best vacation ever. With the help of Richard, we were able to cover as much ground and history as possible in just 5 days. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The off street parking made it even more affordable and we can't wait to book our next visit to the New Orleans area.

reviews.title: Great place, wonderful hosts
reviews.text: We have ever stayed at a bed & breakfast before but this experience was so good that we cant wait to do it again. The Rathbone Inn was very affordable experience and I would highly reccommend it if you are interested in visiting the French Quarter and experiencing old New Orleans.

reviews.title: Wonderful Time
reviews.text: Last year we had a girls' weekend away and stayed at the Rathbone. We had such a great time, we went back again this year. We're planning on making it a yearly tradition!!!

reviews.title: Never again!
reviews.text: I am not fond of B&B's but this place was wonderful! I live right outside of New Orleans but I wanted to give our out of town guests a memorable visit. The place was beautiful, room was spacious and the people (guests and the owner) were as friendly as can be and parking was extremely convenient. We walked to bourbon street and the french market (our car stayed parked from the time we checked in until we checked out). The walk is not bad and we did not feel the least bit concerned of crime in that area. The locals are friendly and non-intimidating and everything that you would like to see or do is within reasonable walking distance, Cab fare is only a few dollars if you do not have the energy to walk.
It was a wonderful experience for all of us.
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.text: This was my fourth trip to New Orleans and second stay at the Rathbone Inn. Our last trip my group stayed in Rathbone II due to AC problems in #1. While the #2 has been refurbished (finishing work when last there) I found the room to be nice but more like a standard motel room.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: However on this visit I really enjoyed the larger apartment like setting that allowed my friend and I have to have our own space. True Rathbone I needs some TLC and Richard remarked it was going to be shut down soon for it (to a hefty amount), but unlike some of the other reviews I've found the staff to be more than helpful and friendly and have not feared for my safety while there.
reviews.title: Just what I hoped for (and expected.)
"Rat Bone Inn" would be a more appropriate name
reviews.text: I think if travelers want to stay in classic Inn's and become part of the city, Rathbone Inn 1 and 2 can be a great deal. If your picky and want t.v. remotes, and hotel services than stay in one on Canal Street or in the quarter and pay the price.

reviews.title: Warmed over low-rent apartments passing as Inn
reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed at the Rathbone in March of '05 and found it to be pleasant, affordable and really just what we had hoped for and expected.

reviews.title: Lovely and quaint
reviews.text: Our room was in the Rathbone II house (and we have absolutely no connections to the innkeeper as other reviews suggest you have to have to get the desirable rooms! ) Our room was really very large for an older home, featuring floor to ceiling windows that made the room light and airy. It was clean and featured a fridge for us to store sodas and snacks. The beds were comfy with clean sheets and comforters that were tasteful and looked pretty new. The room was on the front of the building, so we enjoyed access to the second floor balcony, a perfect place to rest tired feet, read, and watch the world go by in the afternoons before going out at night. Coming to New Orleans we knew that the Rathbone was a little outside of the French Quarter (which it was). It's about a 12 minute walk to the heart of Bourbon St. This was fine during the day, although during the night we opted for cabs -- which are readily available and each one had a very friendly driver (the best I've seen in all my personal and biz travel.)

description: The Historic Rathbone Bed & Breakfast Inn is steps away from the French Quarter, where the cuisine, sights and sounds are part of New Orleans' unique culture. Our Guest House is a lovingly restored antebellum mansion, offering warm southern hospitality and authentic New Orleans atmosphere. Located on beautiful Esplanade Avenue, amongst the ancient Spanish oak trees and 19th-century Creole mansions.
